item.title: Codec achieves Low Code Application development specialisation
item.description:
Codec, one of the largest specialist Microsoft service partners in Ireland and the UK, has set a new standard for innovation, becoming the first Irish Microsoft partner to earn the Low Code Application Development Specialisation. This specialisation reinforces Codec’s position as a trusted partner for public and private organisations seeking to accelerate their business processes through innovative low-code solutions using the Microsoft Power Platform.

“It’s a fantastic achievement to become the first Irish Microsoft partner to earn the Low Code Application Specialisation” said Ronan Stafford, CEO at Codec. “This recognition highlights Codec’s leadership in delivering transformative digital solutions to organisations across Ireland and the UK. We are proud to collaborate with our clients to address their unique challenges, empower their teams, and deliver bespoke, impactful solutions that drive growth and help them realise their ambitions faster.” 

The Microsoft Low Code Application Development Specialisation is awarded to a select group of partners who demonstrate proven expertise in delivering high-quality, scalable, and efficient low-code solutions. With tools like Microsoft Power Apps, Power Automate, and Microsoft Dataverse, Codec has consistently delivered solutions to clients in the Irish and British public and private sectors that reduce development time, enhance collaboration, and drive innovation for clients.  

Codec earned this advanced specialisation by displaying proven success in implementing and scaling low-code solutions that drive measurable business outcomes. This achievement also underscores the team’s technical excellence, certified expertise in Microsoft Power Platform technologies, and a proven methodology that deploys best practices in app development, workflow automation, and seamless system integration. Achieving a Microsoft Business Application specialization requires a high level of  commitment to excellence due to stringent requirements.

“This recognition highlights Codec’s dedication to empowering businesses with fast, cost-effective application development solutions,” said Andrew Smith, General Manager, Partner Program Management at Microsoft. “As businesses face growing demands for agility and digital transformation, we’re glad to see Codec innovating with customers on  Microsoft solutions  to tackle complex challenges, with speed and user adoption at the forefront.” 
  
Low-code development is transforming how businesses innovate, enabling rapid application delivery and empowering 'citizen developers' to play a key role in digital growth. With this advanced specialisation, Codec solidifies its position as a leader in driving digital transformation for Irish and British businesses. Through secure, scalable low-code solutions that streamline processes, they empower clients to resolve inefficiencies and achieve measurable results more quickly and effectively.

Codec is one of the most experienced and certified Microsoft partners in Ireland and the UK. This specialisation builds on our recent achievement of the AI Platform on Microsoft Azure specialisation. Codec is also one of a select number of partners to achieve the Cloud Solutions badge which is only earned when you have all six Microsoft Solutions Partner designations within the Microsoft Cloud Partner Program.

To learn more about how Codec can drive innovation in your organisation through low-code application development and other digital-transformation services, visit codec.ie.

item.title: Codec achieves Microsoft Threat Protection specialisation
item.description:
As cyber threats become increasingly sophisticated, organisations need security partners they can trust. That's why we're proud to announce that Codec has achieved Microsoft's Threat Protection specialisation certification – a validation of our proven ability to protect enterprises against advanced security threats.

"I'm very proud of our team for obtaining this certificate,” said Codec CEO Ronan Stafford. “The constant evolution of technology means that companies need more than just traditional security measures to maintain digital security. This specialisation represents our dedication to excellence in cybersecurity. We wouldn’t have accomplished this without proven client success in this field, and it’s fantastic that this success is now recognised and certified.”

This certification follows two key milestones in cloud security achieved in 2024 – receiving Microsoft's Cloud Security Specialisation and the recognition of our Cloud Security Team Lead, Tushar Kumar, as a Microsoft Most Valued Professional in Azure Networking Infrastructure and Security. These achievements underscore our expertise in delivering enterprise-grade security solutions that protect our clients' digital assets.

Receiving the Threat Specialisation certification validates our expertise in implementing and managing Microsoft's comprehensive security ecosystem, including Microsoft Threat Protection, Microsoft Cloud App Security, and Azure Sentinel. The certification process required our team to demonstrate deep technical knowledge and practical expertise in implementing Microsoft's security solutions across diverse enterprise environments. This comprehensive validation ensures our clients receive best-in-class security solutions that are effective against data loss, cloud app security, and advanced threat detection.

Tushar Kumar, Security Team Lead at Codec and a Microsoft MVP for Azure Infrastructure and Security explained the technical significance behind this certification: "The Microsoft Threat Protection specialisation goes beyond basic security implementation. It validates our ability to architect and deploy integrated security solutions that provide end-to-end protection across cloud and hybrid environments. This means we can offer our clients enhanced threat detection, automated response capabilities, and comprehensive security management through Microsoft's advanced toolset."

item.title: Webinar: Zero Trust rapid adoption - A customer perspective
item.description:
Join us for an insightful webinar, "Zero Trust Rapid Adoption with Microsoft Technology" which will explore how organisations are successfully leveraging Microsoft tools to implement robust Zero Trust strategies. We’ll discuss practical insights, real-world success stories, and actionable guidance to help you accelerate your Zero Trust journey while enhancing security and reducing risks. 

When: Tue 28th Jan @10am 

To Register: Click here 

Additionally, this webinar will address the recent announcements by Microsoft around guidance for CISA Zero Trust Maturity model designed to help organisations configure Microsoft cloud services as they transition to Zero Trust on their journey to achieve optimal security. 

What you'll learn: 

  • The core principles of Zero Trust and why they are essential in today’s security landscape.
  • How Microsoft tools, including Defender, Azure AD, and Microsoft 365, enable a unified Zero Trust architecture.
  • Key success stories from organisations that have implemented Zero Trust strategies.
  • Microsoft’s guidance on the CISA Zero Trust Maturity Model and how to configure Microsoft cloud services for optimal security.
Who Should Attend?
This session is ideal for IT professionals, security officers, compliance managers, and anyone looking to enhance their organisation’s data protection strategy.

We look forward to having you attend the event!

To register, click here!

item.title: Chartered Accountants Ireland Technology Conference 2025
item.description:
Codec are delighted to participate as a key sponsor at the Chartered Accountants annual technology conference taking place online on the 17th January. This conference will explore how AI and emerging technologies are transforming the finance and accountancy profession.

With a keynote from Áine Nolan, CFO, Microsoft Ireland on unlocking the value of AI in Finance, there will also be a number of case studies from companies like the Kerry Group and Future Workforce as well sessions around AI in financial reporting and how the role of the accountant is changing for the future. 

ERP practice lead for Codec, David Wyke will deliver a session on Addressing Challenges in Financial Solution Implementations – in which he will offer practical insights, expert advice, and cutting-edge technology demonstrations to help businesses succeed in their Financial Solutions (FinSol) projects. 

To find out more about the conference and to view the full agenda or to register, click here.

item.title: Webinar: Comprehensive approach to prevent data exfiltration with Microsoft Purview Data Loss Prevention (DLP)
item.description:
Join us for an insightful webinar on the 17th of December at 10am to learn how Microsoft Purview Data Loss Prevention (DLP) can transform the way your organisation safeguards sensitive information. Hosted by Tushar Kumar, discover how to prevent unauthorised sharing, usage, and transfer of critical data across applications, services, endpoints, and on-premises file shares—all managed seamlessly from a single platform.

In this webinar, you will learn:

  • How Microsoft Purview DLP ensures comprehensive data protection.
  • Best practices to prevent data leaks and unauthorised data access.
  • Real-world examples of how Purview DLP supports compliance and security goals.
  • Step-by-step guidance on streamlining your organization’s data security
